blinker.name: Blinker
blinker.author: John Conway
blinker.comments:
A period 2 oscillator that is the smallest and most common oscillator.
www.conwaylife.com/wiki/index.php?title=Blinker

heavyweightSpaceship.name: Heavyweight spaceship
heavyweightSpaceship.author: John Conway
heavyweightSpaceship.comments:
A very well-known period 4 c/2 orthogonal spaceship.
www.conwaylife.com/wiki/index.php?title=Heavyweight_spaceship

glider.name: Glider
glider.author: Richard K. Guy
glider.comments:
The smallest, most common, and first discovered spaceship. Diagonal, has period 4 and speed c/4.
www.conwaylife.com/wiki/index.php?title=Glider

lightweightSpaceship.name: Lightweight spaceship
lightweightSpaceship.author: John Conway
lightweightSpaceship.comments:
A very well-known period 4 c/2 orthogonal spaceship.
www.conwaylife.com/wiki/index.php?title=Lightweight_spaceship

middleweightSpaceship.name: Middleweight spaceship
middleweightSpaceship.author: John Conway
middleweightSpaceship.comments:
A very well-known period 4 c/2 orthogonal spaceship.
www.conwaylife.com/wiki/index.php?title=Middleweight_spaceship

pentadecathlon.name: Pentadecathlon
pentadecathlon.author: John Conway
pentadecathlon.comments:
10 cells placed in a row evolve into this object, which is the most natural oscillator of period greater than 3. In fact, it is the fifth or sixth most common oscillator overall, being about as frequent as the clock, but much less frequent than the blinker, toad, beacon or pulsar.
www.conwaylife.com/wiki/index.php?title=Pentadecathlon

pulsar.name: Pulsar
pulsar.author: John Conway
pulsar.comments:
A period 3 oscillator. Despite its size, this is the fourth most common oscillator (and by
far the most common of period greater than 2).
www.conwaylife.com/wiki/index.php?title=Pulsar

toad.name: Toad
toad.author: Simon Norton
toad.comments:
A period 2 oscillator. The second most common oscillator (after the blinker).
www.conwaylife.com/wiki/index.php?title=Toad
